channel.title: Profile Summary on Vijay Waghmare
channel.description: Recent content in Profile Summary on Vijay Waghmare

item.title: Stock price forecast
item.description: Multivariate stock price forecast model Daily data is used via Yahoo finance. Model is trained on 80% of the data. Significant lagged relationship between independent and dependent variables is identified. Number of forecast days is equal to number of significant lags. Model is mostly useful for swing traders usually with BTST (Buy today sell tomorrow) approach. Variables important to Value or Long term investors are not included. Link to Web App

item.title: Signal processing and time series classification (Motion-Classification with 3 classes)
item.description: Problem: Fatigue level is a psychological state which is difficult to gauge using non-invasive techniques. Data was taken from an existing research paper where 8 participants performed 3 different activities for 3 hours each. IMU and Heart Rate data was captured independent variables. RPE (Rating of Physical Exertion using Borg’s RPE scale) was used as dependent variable which was collected from each participant at 10 minutes time step. Source data is from the research paper “A data-driven approach to modeling physical fatigue in the workplace using wearable sensors”.

item.title: Predict Insurance Premium - Flask, Docker, MicrosoftAzure
item.description: This is a web app using Linear regression model on six independent variables to predict insurance premium. Flask, python, environment was standardized using Docker container which was deployed on MicrosoftAzure Web service. Link to the webapp

item.title: PySpark SQL - Classification and Clustering
item.description: Recently, Kaggle (a data science community and competition platform) released one data set ‘FIFA19‘, which consists of 18K+ FIFA 19 player with around 90 attributes extracted from FIFA database. In this assessment task, we make it available as the data set 2020T2Data.csv. Tasks: Part 1: Exploratory Data Analysis Part 2: Clustering Analysis, and identify the position profiles of each cluster Part 3: Classification Analysis, and evaluate the performance of different algorithms using cross validation

item.title: Human Activity Recognition Machine Learning models
item.description: Objective of the data collection process Objective of the data collected for this experiment was Human Activity Recognition (HAR) which aims to identify the physical actions carried out by a person by sensing human body motion using smartphone’s (Galaxy S II smartphone) sensors (accelerometer and gyroscope). There were 30 subjects (individuals) within age bracket of 19-48 years who performed Activities of Daily Living (ADL) with a waist-mounted smartphone embedded with inertial sensors in laboratory set-up.

item.title: Integrated Borrowers Rating Model
item.description: This is a demo version of the model made for RMA India. Full license of the model is with Risk Management Associates, Pune. India. Model is based on VBA macro for three different industries namely; manufacturing, trading, service. As financial ratios are different for each industry; Financial statement formats dynamically changes as per industry selected by the user on Cover page. Please read user instructions for details. Link to the file

item.title: MySQL with VBA macro
item.description: ClassicModels.xlsm is a simple macro to extract data from MySQL database and load it on excel spreadsheet. It contains three macros; Extract list of tables from the database Load data from selected table on excel spreadsheet Clear loaded data and list of tables from excel spreadsheet Copy MySQL ClassicModels database in below path. Please note, path might be different on your computer. C:\ProgramData\MySQL\MySQL Server 8.0\Data Enter server details on Worksheet 1.

item.title: Project Appraisal including sensitivity analysis with VBA macro
item.description: Project appraisal with sensitivity and scenario analysis is not only crucial bankers and businesses to check financial feasibility of the project. Every project begins with estimated values of expenses, interest rates, income, inflation etc. Thus, testing sensitivity of capital budgeting tools such as Net Present Value (NPV), Internal Rate of Return (IRR) of estimated income against changes key estimated variables. Quality Cables project contains sensitivity analysis along with Monte Carlo simulation with 100 paths.

item.title: Case study - Business analysis for a car insurance brokerage service
item.description: This case study involves analyzing sample customers data with their demographics, broker, insurer, savings, and satisfcation using descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, ANOVA test including simple effect analysis Link to the file Link to case study report

item.title: Case study - Business analysis for a superstore
item.description: This case study involves analyzing data for 150 superstores with financial performance, manager details, competitors, car space availibility, online presnce etc. Descriptive statistics, regression, ANOVA, interaction effect, logistic regression, and timeseries forecasting techniques are used in excel Link to Case study Link to the file Link to case study report

item.title: International Students Forecast using ARIMA and LSTM
item.description: Due to black swan events like COVID-19 which calls for desperate measures during desperate time, i.e. sealing International Australian borders. Education sector has huge financial setback which is third largest contributor to Australian GDP. Thus, forecasting number of international students in 2021 and 2022, we can estimate financial loss or opportunity forgone. Data was taken from below website along with ARIMA and LSTM models in Python. https://internationaleducation.gov.au/research/international-student-data/Pages/InternationalStudentData2020.aspx Link to Github Repository

item.title: Deep Learning - CNN (My model, ResNet, VGG16) on Fashion Mnist and CIFAR10 dataset
item.description: Context The CIFAR-10 dataset consists of 60000 32x32 colour images in 10 classes, with 6000 images per class. There are 50000 training images and 10000 test images. The dataset is divided into five training batches and one test batch, each with 10000 images. The test batch contains exactly 1000 randomly-selected images from each class. The training batches contain the remaining images in random order, but some training batches may contain more images from one class than another.

item.title: Deep Learning - FCN on Fashion Mnist
item.description: Context Fashion-MNIST is a dataset of Zalando’s article images—consisting of a training set of 60,000 examples and a test set of 10,000 examples. Each example is a 28x28 grayscale image, associated with a label from 10 classes. Zalando intends Fashion-MNIST to serve as a direct drop-in replacement for the original MNIST dataset for benchmarking machine learning algorithms. It shares the same image size and structure of training and testing splits.

item.title: Descriptive statistics on JobPostings data from Kaggle using NLTK
item.description: Context In 2017, Kaggle (a data science community and competition platform) conducted a survey on a large range of users registered as the data scientist in their platform. The survey data are broadly covered the skill set of the data scientists, the demographic of the data scientists, the feedback of the platform and many other information. Tasks: Part 1: Given the following two data sets, you are required to finish some required analysis, with the exploreation data analytics skills as well as visuilization skills MCQResponses.

item.title: Image classification - Clustering and dimensionality reduction
item.description: Clustering and dimensionality reduction on digits dataset using sklearn library. This dataset contains 8x8 pixel images of digits 0-9. Link to PDF File Link to Github Repository

item.title: Binary and Multiclass classification Machine Learning models
item.description: Objective of this task was to hyper tuning of Logistic Regression for binary and multiclass classification. Wisconsin Breast Cancer for binary classification and Mnist dataset for multiclass classification was used. Link to HTML File Link to Github Repository

item.title: Machine Learning Deployment (Heroku App)
item.description: Salary prediction using Linear Regression model on demo dataset available on Kaggle. Credits: Youtube video by Mr. Krish Naik. Appreciate your efforts on wonderful tutorial!! Link to Deployed ML model Link to Github Repository

item.title: Aggregation functions using R Software
item.description: Objective: To predict Energy consumption using temperature and humidity of Kitchen and Outside, and Visibility (Five explanatory variables). Dataset: The ‘LasVegas’ dataset is a Multivariate dataset that provides details on 504 TripAdvisor reviews of the 21 hotels located in the Strip, Las Vegas. Models: Aggregation functions Weighted Arithmetic Mean (WAM), Weighted power means (WPM with p = 0.5 and 2), Ordered Weighted Average (OWA), and Choquet integral (Fuzzy measure) using R software.

item.title: LasVegas: Tableau Dashboard
item.description: Objective: To create interactive dashboard for a client. Dataset: The ‘LasVegas’ dataset is a Multivariate dataset that provides details on 504 TripAdvisor reviews of the 21 hotels located in the Strip, Las Vegas. Audience: User of the dashboard created using Las Vegas dataset is Chris Brooks, manager at Wyndham Grand Desert (3-Star hotel) who is keen to perform SWOT analysis based on travelers’ feedback (review score). Chris would like to assess Wyndham’s strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats with respect to other 3-Star hotels in the region (competitors).

item.title: Probability, Bayesian Statistics, Clustering, Mixed Gaussian Distributions using R Software
item.description: Objective: This was rigorous task involving solving problems mathematically manually and then by R programming. It covered basic topics from Probability, Bayesian Statistics, Clustering, Mixed Gaussian Distribution. Dataset: HeronIslandWaterTemp.csv IOCdata2020.txt LZIsData.csv Models: Linear regression, Kmeans clustering, NormalMix MOdels Click for complete solution Link to Github Repository

item.title: Sales: PowerBI Dashboard
item.description: Objective: Interactive dashboard for auto spares/accessories sales data for period 2003 to 2005. Dataset: ClassicModels sample MySQL database from MySQL website. Observations: SalesSummary page informs customer Year till date (YTD) of the report and allows user to select date range and/or operational country. Map provides quick preview of geographical density of Sales in dollars (assumed to be all converted to base USD). Monthly time series plot provides preview on monthly trend in sales data.

item.title: Graph theory and Bayesian Network using R Software
item.description: Objective: This was rigorous task involving solving problems using Graph theory and Bayesian network and its inference on hailfinder dataset. Dataset: hailfinder Models: Graph theory and Bayesian Network Click for complete solution Link to Github Repository

item.title: Kmeans and Hierarchical Clustering
item.description: Objective: Clustering customers based on Gender, Age, Education years, and Wages. Useful in demographic research in marketing or political analytics. Dataset: Wages datasets from Damodar Gujarati’s Econometrics Book Models: Kmeans and Hierarchical Clustering Click for presentation on solution Link to Github Repository

item.title: Stock market prediction - ARIMA and Holt's Winter Smoothing
item.description: Objective: Comparison between ARIMA and Holt’s Winter Exponential Smoothing (With and Without trend) Dataset: Random time series data and Bharti Infratel stock (now ticker INDUSTOWER on NSE India) Models: ARIMA and Holt’s Winter Exponential Smoothing (With and Without trend) Click for explantory comments Link to Github Repository
